name: alphabeta
description: This extension adds an indicator when you use a symbol that is tagged with @alpha, @beta, and @internal in the JS or TS documentation comment.  You can also add your own tokens.

AlphaBETA.control.showAnnotations.description: If this is enabled, any usage of APIs marked as @alpha, @beta, or @internal in their JSDoc comments will be highlighted.

AlphaBETA.phase.showInternal.markdownDescription: If enabled, symbols annotated with the `@internal` flag will be highlighted.  Depends on `#AlphaBETA.control.showAnnotations#`

AlphaBETA.phase.showAlpha.markdownDescription: If enabled, symbols annotated with the `@alpha` flag will be highlighted.  Depends on `#AlphaBETA.control.showAnnotations#`

AlphaBETA.phase.showBeta.markdownDescription: If enabled, symbols annotated with the `@beta` flag will be highlighted.  Depends on `#AlphaBETA.control.showAnnotations#`

AlphaBETA.control.refreshInterval.description: Specifies the number of seconds that elapse between updates.  If you experience slow performance you can increase this number.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
